item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 2, 2025 at 11:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Geothermal power is a climate moon shot beneath our feet (144 points | 119 comments)
2. Smallpond – A lightweight data processing framework built on DuckDB and 3FS (137 points | 40 comments)
3. Speedrunners are vulnerability researchers, they just don't know it yet (162 points | 48 comments)
4. Gooey rubber that's slowly ruining old hard drives (25 points | 1 comment)
5. The Pentium contains a complicated circuit to multiply by three (161 points | 48 comments)
6. API design note: Beware of adding an "Other" enum value (81 points | 50 comments)
7. CSS Custom Functions are coming and they are going to be a game changer (4 points | discuss)
8. Matt's Script Archive (1995) (40 points | 19 comments)
9. Turning my ESP32 into a DNS sinkhole to fight doomscrolling (43 points | 7 comments)
10. Schools reviving shop class (77 points | 36 comments)
11. Hallucinations in code are the least dangerous form of LLM mistakes (73 points | 59 comments)
12. Imec demonstrates electrical yield for 20nm lines High NA EUV single patterning (16 points | 4 comments)
13. Prompting Large Language Models in Bash Scripts (10 points | discuss)
14. Why do we have both CSRF protection and CORS? (75 points | 47 comments)
15. Verifiable science on modified PCR machine (29 points | 6 comments)
16. Nvidia GPU on bare metal NixOS Kubernetes cluster explained (12 points | 1 comment)
17. Gödel's theorem debunks the most important AI myth – Roger Penrose [video] (41 points | 83 comments)
18. Distro (YC S24) is hiring a marketing lead in Palo Alto ( | hide)
19. I struggled with Git, so I'm making a game to spare others the pain (107 points | 120 comments)
20. Raspberry Pi Pico audio player (110 points | 24 comments)
21. olduse.net (92 points | 11 comments)
22. Show HN: Fast Transition from Firefox to Librewolf (38 points | 15 comments)
23. New battery-free technology can power devices using ambient RF signals (63 points | 28 comments)
24. Show HN: Recommendarr – AI Driven Recommendations Based on Sonarr/Radarr Media (56 points | 28 comments)
25. Google does not want rights to things you do using Chrome (2008) (117 points | 56 comments)
26. When Professor Bryant Lin got cancer, he taught a class about it (62 points | 15 comments)
27. Stone tool analysis in Southeast Asia provides evidence of seafaring technology (22 points | 9 comments)
28. Effective Rust (2024) (129 points | 72 comments)
29. 2025 Hiring Pause (130 points | 88 comments)
30. Towards a test suite for TOTP codes (67 points | 20 comments)
